description: Compression of various metals has resulted in a super strong metal plating.
A robust and advanced circuit board.
Aegisalt ore. Can be used for smelting.
A godly and thunderous alloy composed of the densest and rarest substances in the Cosmos.

A potent natural adhesive that is commonly found in certain mushrooms.
^green;+^white;1 ^green;produce ^gray;& ^cyan;-^white;1 ^cyan;seed use^reset;
An unrivaled chipset capable of impossibly complex processes.
Ale mash, the product of soaked wheat, yellow petals and water.
Strange compounds with various amazing uses in scientific research.
A weird type of alien wood.
This strange substance is stench-ridden and crawling with unknown microbes.
A sulfur-rich inorganic salt.
These large bones are old. Very old.
Some sort of previously undiscovered Ancient technology.

A 'natural' opposite to neutronium. Exceptionally unsafe.
^blue;+^white;600 ^blue;Fuel^reset;
A blue gem cut into sharp edges. It feels ice cold.
Apple Mash, the product of crushed and squeezed apples.
An enhanced brain, perfect for transplanting.
Able to hold the energy of the cosmos.
Bamboo for crafting goods.
It's the pelt of an animal.
This battery can be used to power hi-tech stations, weapons and wearables!

A decent biofuel.
^blue;+^white;8 ^blue;Fuel^reset;

A superior biofuel.
^blue;+^white;15 ^blue;Fuel^reset;

A truly amazing fuel source.
^blue;+^white;25 ^blue;Fuel^reset;
A sample of novel biological compounds and genetic information.
An unusual spore that produces its own light. It might prove useful in experiments.
A strange slime with fascinating properties. May be toxic.
Purified, extracted bloodstone.
A small metal bolt.
It's a bone.
Perfect for storing liquids.
This brain looks to be perfect for experimentation.
They don't make better brains than this. Perfection.
The old, withered shell of some long-dead insect.
Cause of death thus far: undetermined. Autopsy for details.
The remains of an alien, ready to investigate via autopsy.
These are of Avian royal descent.
These remains are well into putrefaction stage. Nasty.
A compound that could prove useful in fertilizers and other chemical compounds.
A square of high-quality canvas.
Ooey-gooey caramel!
Carbon plating can be used for armor or other goods.

Impossibly good fuel.
^blue;+^white;3000 ^blue;Fuel^reset;
A material produced from various mixtures of cells.
Cell Matter - it can be used to craft unspeakable things.
A cell riddled with unusual biological mutations.
An engineered cell.
Potentially dangerous viral cells.
Cherry Mash, the product of crushed and squeezed cherries.
A stone that can be used to produce mercury via extraction.
Spicy cinnamon sticks!
It's a typical circuit board, used in many electronics.
It's coal. A decent source of fuel.
It's a cog.
A special electrical coil. It has the ability to charge itself.
Ore for copper bars is found at shallow depths on most planets around all stars.
Copper ore. Can be used for smelting.
It radiates a pleasant warmth.
These naturally occurring crystals produce energy.
A strange entropy-riddled ore that bridges two realities together.
Applied sparingly to various materials to encourage unusual changes in structure.
A tuft of natural cotton fibre.
A roll of processed cotton.
A high-end processor.
An icy organic chemical. Can be used for crafting.
Shiny crystal.
A strange, unknowably ancient artifact.
Ale mash, the product of malt, yellow petals and water.
Roasted malt!
The stuff of raw entropy across the universe.
Wort! Used for making lager!
Aegisalt, violium and ferozium have formed this into a dense alloy.
A rare multi-phasic super-dense metal.
A morphic-state form of Osmium, the densest metal

A condensed rod of Deuterium.
^blue;+^white;2 ^blue;Fuel^reset;
It's a beautifully cut diamond.
A dragon bone, it's hot to the touch. The heat never dies.
Ore for durasteel bars is primarily found on planets orbiting radioactive stars.
Durasteel ore. Can be used for smelting.
A purely cosmetic gemstone to the Eld'uukhar. It is grown purely to trade.
A shiny shard of ebon gemstone.
Light has issues refracting off of this shadowy surface, rendering this metal nearly invisible.
An almost invisible crystalline metal due to its large traces of the element Rhodium.
What purpose could this thing serve?
This stone reads as inorganic, yet bleeds if cut.
Some sort of power core, or perhaps a battery.
Lost knowledge of an unknown race.
Some sort of warding symbol.
A non-euclidian artifact.
A piece of the fabled Celaeno.
A small shard from a larger blade. Ancient.
This glowing device is marked with ancient, unknown script.
A strange glyph with an embossed symbol.
Fractal patterns swirl within a red crystalline sphere.
The purpose of these runed wands is unknown.
This seems to be a hand-sized power source. Origin unknown.
A bust of a hideous alien. Probably not the best decoration. Unless you're evil.
A book containing ancient and malign texts.
An advanced electromagnet.
A brittle gemstone that is spun into strong crystal fabric.
Just an empty glass bottle.
A strange jelly that seems to react to touch.

An improved form of plutonium.
^blue;+^white;28 ^blue;Fuel^reset;

An improved form of uranium.
^blue;+^white;25 ^blue;Fuel^reset;
A gem grown in secret on the Eld'uukhar homeworld. It has hallucinogenic properties.
Elusive, and potentially impossible.
A small square of woven fabric.
Ferozium ore. Can be used for smelting.
Used to store thermal energy for later use.
An array that can redirect passing particle streams.
By the power of science, behold Polyetheretherketone! This synthetic compound is strong, heat-resistant, and bio-compatible.
Useful for adhesives, and hardening certain materials.
This element has many uses in science and tech due to its semiconductor property.
Handy bits. Probably worth extracting, too.
Fills up your ship's fuel
Clay cooked into a solid brick.
A long, sinewy strand of flesh.
It's a fossil. I wonder what kind it is.
A frozen chunk of beeswax.
A chunk of solid amber.
A bloody brain still pulsing with grossness.
A material used as a catalyst to refine mech fuel.
Dense, tough bone such as a femur.
The skin from a body.
The skin from a body.
Whispers from the cosmos compel you to write this text.
A mass of internal organs
A pile of hair.
Somebody had a heart. This was it.
Something had a heart. This was it.
An amazing super-fabric with nearly magical potential.
Top-of-the-line computing power.
A tooth.
There exist more chemical compounds involving Carbon than don't.
A common trace gas with many applications.
Pure carbon graphite.
Your hard-earned work, ready for use in experiments and blueprints

Wonderful applications exist for this, the lightest element.
^blue;+^white;1 ^blue;Fuel^reset;

A quantum-viable super-conductor.
^blue;+^white;10 ^blue;Fuel^reset;

Great for fertilizing a hydroponics tray.
^green;Growth Rate x^white;1.25 ^gray;& ^cyan;-^white;1 ^cyan;seed use^reset;
Pure diatomic ^gray;N2^reset; nitrogen gas.
Primarily found in rare deep-water plants, this unusual compound is rich with aberrant genes.
Oxygen is one of the most versatile elements, with many uses.
Common table salt ^gray;NaCl^reset; is extremely useful in everything from culinary arts to chemical engineering.
^red;DEPRECATED: EXTRACT TO RECLAIM SEEDS^reset;
These cells aren't hardy, but they adapt quickly to survive.
This gene increases overall physical agility or metabolism.
Swim fast. Sharks are dangerous.
Water survival is impossible without it.
Can convert certain cells into itself.
The genes of a bird.
Cells that glow.
Strong photosynthetic ability means a hardy plant.
Corrosive toxin, or similar mechanisms, come from this gene.
Brr. Chalked full of icy goodness.
These cells are protected by some means.
Capable of generating electric charge.
High energy concentrations can be found in these cells.
Cells of a fish or other water-dweller.
Tough cells built to withstand stress.
Immune to specific effects.
Creepy crawly properties infuse this cell.
Mammalian cells define this gene.
This gene copies others around it.
Muscle control, strength or enhancement come from this gene.
Extra connecting tissues.
Eyes where there shouldn't be.
Makes things sick or dead.
All things related to heat.
Anger and rage, and rage and anger. Grr.
Kablooie. These cells explode with purpose.
Restore themselves.
Resistant to outside forces.
Bones and plates and increased bone toughness.
Shhhh. Be vewy vewy quiet.
Creates powerful effects on the body.
Unknown. What is this?
A chunk of semi transparent, white-hued wax. Known to be a potent hallucinogen.
A giant flower petal. Soft!
A pane of glass used for crafting.
A coffee mug made of glass.
Bulbous, bioluminescent plant fibres. They glow with many colours!
It's a gnome.
Ore for gold bars is found at great depths on most planets around all stars.
It's some gold ore. Can be used for smelting.
A bottle filled with the basis of yeast.
Grape Mash, the product of crushed and squeezed grapes.
This sheet of pure carbon is seemingly magical due to its extreme durability, flexibilty, and conductivity despite being only 1-atom thick!
A blob of green slime.
A fragment of tough organic shell. Can be used for crafting.
It is an iron hinge.
The essence of the holiday season, in its purest form!
A perfectly re-shaped piece of lunari, ready to charge with energy.
A wooden bucket dripping with golden honey
Hops! Used for making beer!

Hydrogen and Dark Matter combined to provide ample power.
^blue;+^white;8000 ^blue;Fuel^reset;
A fantastic, conductive material ideal for circuitry.
A highly efficent circuitry made out of hydrolium, commonly used by the Skath.
A cold ice crystal, it never seems to thaw.
Impervium, carefully prepared for crafting furniture with.
A waste of brain cells.
Iodine ^gray;I^reset; is extremely useful as it is the heaviest and therefore most heat-resistant halogen.
Ore for iron bars is primarily found on planets orbiting gentle stars.
Iron ore. Can be used for smelting.
Compressed, purified irradium. Generally found on Irradiated worlds.
Irradium is a rare and valuable radioactive metal. Handle with care!

A super-cold alloy with numerous powerful applications.
Often located on Ice Wastes.
This unusual aluminum-heavy compound is the most endothermic metal ever discovered
Despite being made out of kelp, this material is both durable and flexible.
A purple and green gem that sparkles in the sun.
An unrivaled chipset capable of impossibly complex processes, warped by maddening influences.
An ore that can be used to produce phosphorus via extraction.
An alien, baby larva. It's small, squishy, and defenseless.
It's a laser diode.
Lead ^gray;Pb^reset; is notable for being denser than other common metals, great for radiation shielding, but also poisonous.
A square of leather.
It's a lightbulb.
A severed piece of evolved plant matter. Can be used for crafting.
Great for creating magnesium powder!
Magnesium ^gray;Mg2+^reset; ions in a lab-ready, powdery form!
This salt is very useful in agriculture by increasing magnesium and sulfur content in soil.
A material shielded against electromagnetic waves.
Roasted sprouted wheat!
Mascagnite is a mineral abundant in Ammonium Sulfate, which can be extracted.
Converts matter into new states. Quite useful for gas/liquid/solid conversions.
A matter block. A block that matters.
A metal coating over a wood-like material.
This light, volatile alcohol is produced from destructive extraction from wood.
An extremely toxic, but useful lab reagent.
A basic microchip.
A very powerful molten core. Can be used to craft a metalwork station!
Plating from a monster.
Forged Telebrium, commonly found on moons.
Moonstone ore, found only on moons and often used for FTL engine construction.
Lab-created and highly malleable metal that can serve many uses.
A lab-built custom alloy. Tough but malleable.
A potent mutagenic extract, laced with various single-celled experiments.
A powerful mutagenic extract with multiple lab applications.
This mutagen is nearly devoid of useful material, yet can adversely affect cell structure.
Vibrant with moving colors, this bizarre substance can alter the structure of cells.
Superior, resistant and durable silk fibres.
A versatile, resistant thread made from Mutavisk plants.

Commonly used in weapons development
^blue;+^white;4 ^blue;Fuel^reset;

This radioactive isotope is typically found on Threat 3+ planets.
^blue;+^white;5 ^blue;Fuel^reset;

A substance composed purely of neutrons. Ultra-dense.
^blue;+^white;300 ^blue;Fuel^reset;
A blue gem that grows in a teardrop shape. It feels cold to touch.
A high quality, stiff paper.
An abhorrent metal created of raw chaos.
Raw, untainted Nocxium.
Great and terrible nuclear power. Handle with care.
The main power source of the Eld'uukhar. Its liquid form has slight healing properties.
An incredibly strong gem that is primarily used for creating glass in Eld'uukhar temples.
It's a sheet of paper.
The energy source for particle weapons.
Peach Mash, the product of crushed and squeezed peaches.
Pear Mash, the product of crushed and squeezed pears.
It's the pelt of an animal.
Some super-hard penumbrite, waiting to be smelted.
A perfectly refined shard of penumbrite, located on Penumbra planets.
A blue petal, could be turned into dye.
A red petal, could be turned into dye.
A yellow petal, could be turned into dye.
A substance that appears to be almost intangible. Can be used for crafting.
The main power source of the Pharitu. Eld'uukhar grow it in a much weaker form.
A life-essential non-metallic chemical element.
A set of plant fibres.

A pulsing core of energized plasma. 
^blue;+^white;250 ^blue;Fuel^reset;
It's a platinum bar.
It's platinum.
It's pretty, but extremely radioactive.
Nobody's going to want this. It's highly radioactive.
It's some space age polymer.
A power core used to energize tech.
You've no idea what metals this is made from.
A battery made of some now unknown form of energy. Looks valuable.
Able to store potent charges for various uses.
Incredibly powerful neuron-based processor.
A quantum-state energy matrix suspended in...antimatter?
Physical storage containing unknown ancient secrets.

A nearly magical space-time fluid suspended in a portable gravity well.
^blue;+^white;200 ^blue;Fuel^reset;
A hand-held fuel cell with limitless potential!
A hybrid gel capable of multiple states simultaneously.
A strange fluid with no true stable state.
What wonders are stored within?
Some form of data-storage, not unlike RAM.
It's a prism shard!
It's a prisilite star! Some of the toughest stuff in the galaxy!
A very powerful processor.

Artifact from an ancient race.
^green;Research in a microscope.^reset;
A bar of compressed protocite, found on Protoworlds.
A unique element found only on protoworlds.

The harnessed mental energy of sapient beings, ready to be used as power.
^blue;+^white;10 ^blue;Fuel^reset;

Infused with additional power.
^blue;+^white;20 ^blue;Fuel^reset;

A massively charged psionic energy cell.
^blue;+^white;35 ^blue;Fuel^reset;

The most potent form of psionic energy.
^blue;+^white;50 ^blue;Fuel^reset;

You've never seen a more pristine erchius crystal.
^blue;+^white;25 ^blue;Fuel^reset;
A naturally hot metal with high durability. Typically found on Infernus worlds.
An ore that burns eternally.
Able to hold super-sharp edges, and withstand kinetic force.
A strange ore that challenges the scientific definition of "life"
Rainbow Wood, the most colourful wood of all.
Jammed full of genetic materials.
Jammed full of genetic materials.
Jammed full of genetic materials.
Jammed full of genetic materials.
Jammed full of genetic materials.
A holy gem to the Eld'uukhar. Produces severe hallucinations when consumed.
A key part of most reactors, keeping energy contained and stored.
Able to revive dead flesh with the help of a proper catalyst.
Long thought impossible to create, this supreme energy is exceptionally dangerous.
A red chunk of beeswax.
A bunch of cut reeds.
Ore for refined aegisalt is primarily found on planets orbiting frozen stars.
Ore for refined ferozium is primarily found on planets orbiting frozen stars.
Ore for refined violium is primarily found on planets orbiting frozen stars.
Reacts with the Oceanite in Eld'uukhar tech to create a small amount (+2) of fuel.
Strong robot arms, capable of lifting heavy objects.
A robot chest, strong as steel.
A robot head, complete with living brain!
Robot legs, for mobility!
A blood red gem.
A gem harvested in a similar shape to Thanatite.
An informational brochure about a science facility.
The source of a creature's fiery abilities. Can be used for crafting.
A handful of metal screws.
Some alien seaweed.
A droid behavior module.
A servitor chassis. Perhaps I could build my own droid!
A potential weapon system for a droid.
A razor sharp monster claw. Can be used for crafting.
Chunks of flesh from a horrifying Shoggoth.
A silicon board. Can be used to craft electronics.
A square of soft, lustrous silk
A bundle of silk fibres.
Ore for silver bars is found at moderate depths on most planets around all stars.
It's silver. Can be used for smelting.
Can produce magnesium and phosphorus via extraction.
The sturdiest material there is. Too stiff and expensive to be used for armor though.
Sturdy and durable glass.
This battery can be used to power small electronic devices!
A perfectly preserved snowflake. They say no two of these are ever the same.
A very soggy wheat seed.
Condensed and hardened Lunari crystal.
A sparkling yellow crystal shard.
It's solarium. It's warm to the touch.
Ore to make solarium stars is primarily found on planets orbiting fiery stars.
^red;DEPRECATED: EXTRACT TO RECLAIM SEEDS^reset;
A cluster of electrically charged cell matter. Can be used for crafting.
A classic universal computer chip. Can be used for crafting.
You never know when a bit of string might come in handy.
This common element is essential to life despite readily forming explosive compounds.
A square of synthetic material.
This could be used for making stim packs.
A rare, hi-tech key component of a personal teleporter.
An extremely durable material consisting of bonded durasteel and penumbrite
Tethyde, carefully prepared for crafting furniture with.
A gem that generates thermal energy. Can be used to keep warm on colder planets.

Commonly used in weapons development.

This radioactive isotope is typically found on Threat 4+ planets.

Thread enhanced with living root.
Ore for titanium bars is primarily found on planets orbiting temperate stars.
It's titanium. Can be used for smelting.
A green gem that rings with a high tone when struck.
Sludge this toxic shouldn't go to waste!
Trianglium Ore. Beautiful smooth shiny triangles.
A melding of trianglium shards, which are found in many unusual places.
A fantastic alloy composed of various metals.

A rod of tritium. Product of fission.
^blue;+^white;3 ^blue;Fuel^reset;
Ore for tungsten bars is primarily found on planets orbiting gentle stars.
It's tungsten. It can be used for smelting.

A unique isotope created by very specific circumstances.
^blue;+^white;120 ^blue;Fuel^reset;
A bizarre quadruple-helix gene.
Unstable but contained particles for use in weapons, energy projection and more.
A gemstone often used to strengthen Emera to create more sturdy fabric.
It's uranium. A good source of fuel.
It's a uranium rod.
A sample of volatile venomous fluid. Can be used for crafting.
Violium ore. Can be used for smelting.
A dangerous powder, useful for crafting explosives.
A key component in FTL drives.
A chunk of beeswax.
A wheat seed that has sprouted!
A segment of some wild vines.
It's a glass. For wine. Duh.
A spool of copper wire.
Wort! Used for making beer!
Crystal stretched and spun into fabric.
A corpse, wound unceremoniously in cloth to prevent gore leaving a mess.
A wrapped corpse of an unknown alien species.
A corpse, bound in an elaborate gold-plated casket.
A rotting, putrid corpse best avoided by the sane.
You have absolutely no idea what this could be. But the language imprints itself in your brain, revealing secrets.
A highly radioactive plant-like bulb.
A pan-dimensional powerhouse often found in aether seas.
A super-dense crystalline metal.
A bottle filled with brewing yeast.
Has the highest melting point magnitudes, greater than even tungsten! Found on Mountainous worlds.
Can be refined into a nearly unmeltable alloy.
